image.altText: A lady at a park blurred to protect her safety

props.synopsis: The federal government is being urged to consider legal changes to allow the ATO to waive debts incurred through financial abuse, as the office ramps up use of its powers to recover $56 billion owed by small businesses and individuals.

title.children: ATO debt collector tells financial abuse survivor 'we always go after the women'

image.altText: An aerial image shows heavily flooded rural areas of Russia

props.synopsis: Parts of South America upgrade their tsunami threat warnings as other countries reduce their advice following Russian earthquake.

title.children: Tsunami warnings still active after Russian earthquake

image.altText: A man does a thumbs up to the camera in an operating room next to a patient. He and another person wear gowns and masks.

props.synopsis: Former patients and colleagues of Greg Malham have contacted Four Corners to describe their own dealings with the neurosurgeon and what they say was inappropriate care and follow-up.

title.children: Hospital to refer patient complaint about neurosurgeon to medical regulator

image.altText: A woman with short brown hair and glasses looks down slightly.

props.synopsis: What do you get when inflation falls at the same time unemployment is rising? Rate cuts.Â

title.children: August rate cut appears certain. How many after that?

image.altText: Anthony Field and a man with a beard pictured next to clouds

props.synopsis: Ozone therapy claims to reduce inflammation and even treat cancer, but there is limited clinical evidence that it works. So why are Australians spending thousands to use it?

title.children: 'Unqualified and unregistered': Sydney's dodgy ozone therapy clinics

image.altText: Anthony Albanese in a suit with purple tie sitting in parliament

props.synopsis: Australia now has some cover to follow the UK and France on a Palestinian state without fearing a backlash from the US.

title.children: Anthony Albanese hardens on Israel as pressure builds within Labor caucus

image.altText: Jim Chalmers, wearing a thoughtful expression, stands in front of a dark background.

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers says any rate relief would be welcome following confirmation inflation has hit a four-year low. Follow live.

title.children: Chalmers would welcome rate relief after 'remarkable' inflation data

props.synopsis: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney says the prospects of a two-state solution have been "steadily and gravely eroded".Â

title.children: Breaking: Canada to recognise Palestinian state

image.altText: Two men in suits shake hands looking neutrally at each other with a man and woman sitting behind them

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says the US will impose a 25 per cent tariff on Indian goods from August 1, along with an unspecified "penalty" for buying Russian weapons and oil.Â

title.children: Trump targets India, Brazil and copper in another round of tariffs

image.altText: A woman standing infront of a light house

props.synopsis: Zali Steggall warns that the costs of climate change must be a focus at the government's productivity roundtable, with the issue already costing billions. She says a levy on fossil fuel exports could help fund climate disaster prevention.Â

title.children: Climate costs missing from productivity roundtable, says Steggall

image.altText: Teenage students solve maths problems in workbooks.

props.synopsis: After 17 years of NAPLAN testing, Australia is yet to see a big turnaround in results â so what can be done to improve them?

title.children: 'Postcode, privilege' â not education system â shaping 'opportunity'

image.altText: A woman walking past a TV screen showing a tsunami evacuation notice.

props.synopsis: The East Asian country, sitting on one of the most geologically active parts of the world, is no stranger to the threat of tsunamis. That became clear as its 121 million people responded to Wednesday's threat.

title.children: How Japan was so well-prepared for the Russian tsunami threat

image.altText: A dark van with a stripe on the bottom and a roof rack in dirt around bushland.

props.synopsis: After the German backpacker's miracle survival in West Australian bush, local farmers have worked together to recover her abandoned van.

title.children: Farmers brave tough terrain to recover Carolina Wilga's abandoned van

image.altText: A man pictured smiling at the altar on his wedding day.

props.synopsis: Father of two Brian Dean died of sepsis about 24 hours after he was discharged from a Geelong hospital. His family and their lawyer want a coroner to examine whether the death was preventable.

title.children: Family of man who died a day after hospital discharge pushes for inquest

image.altText: Laura Dahlmeier holds up her hands and smiles in front of the Olympic rings while wearing a gold medal.

props.synopsis: German biathlete Laura Dahlmeier has died, aged 31, after being hit by a rockfall while climbing in the mountains of Pakistan.

title.children: Olympic gold medallist dies in mountain climbing accident

image.altText: A woman with a baby on her back with a rifle hanging on the wall in the background.

props.synopsis: Americans are being encouraged to have more children by the likes of Donald Trump, JD Vance and Elon Musk. And even though the risks for the poster families of pronatalism are real they are happy to bear them.

title.children: 'A worthwhile way to die': Inside America's pronatalist movement

image.altText: A small wood heater with fire wood

props.synopsis: A new generation of low-emission wood heaters that produce a fraction of the particulate pollution of current models could save lives by improving air quality, researchers say.

title.children: NZ has ultra-low emission wood heaters. Why doesn't Australia?

image.altText: A rocket taking off

props.synopsis: Gilmour Space's orbital rocket Eris came down quickly after an engine failure this week, but the Australian company behind the attempt is undeterred.

title.children: Aussie rocket launch deemed a success despite crash after 14 seconds

image.altText: People stand by the side of the road dressed in Black Sabbath tshirts.

props.synopsis: Fans of Black Sabbath frontman Ozzy Osbourne flocked to the streets of Birmingham in the United Kingdom to pay tribute to the late musician as part of a public procession ahead of his funeral service.

title.children: Ozzy Osbourne fans line Birmingham streets to pay tribute ahead of funeral

image.altText: A police car at night

props.synopsis: A police officer has opened fire and killed a man assaulting a woman east of Melbourne.

title.children: Police shoot dead man assaulting woman east of Melbourne

image.altText: couple carrying moving boxes

props.synopsis: When looking to buy a new home to live in, you might be wondering if it's best to sell your current property first. Both options have advantages and risks, experts explain.

title.children: Should you sell your existing property before buying another?

image.altText: A woman in a pool swimming the freestyle stroke.

props.synopsis: An Australian race in 1901 helped bring the freestyle stroke to the world.

title.children: The Australian race that changed how we swim

image.altText: Canberra's coat of arms

props.synopsis: The Jumbunna review recommends "priority" systemic racism reviews of ACT Policing and Canberra's jail, and an inquiry into recent deaths in custody.

title.children: 'Police target your name': Scathing review of ACT Indigenous incarceration

image.altText: A house on a rural block.

props.synopsis: Convicted triple-murderer Erin Patterson has been barred from selling the home in which she served her relatives a deadly beef Wellington meal so it may be used in future compensation claims by her victims or their families.

title.children: Mushroom murderer Erin Patterson barred from selling Leongatha home

image.altText: A man in a blue and red shirt and jacket holding a lobster in a white room.

props.synopsis: The harmful algal bloom is already impacting the fishing industry, with producers asking customers to keep buying to avoid piling on pain.

title.children: SA fishers urge people to keep buying seafood amid algal bloom

image.altText: An Aboriginal child's hands playing with a toy tractor in a sandpit.

props.synopsis: As spit hoods are revived, police are handed stronger use-of-force powers and kids are sent to adult watch houses, critics say new data shows governments have abandoned Closing the Gap.

title.children: 'Human rights violation': Expert's grim warning on kids behind bars

image.altText: Two men in suits pose arm in arm smiling

props.synopsis: Patients honour Brisbane surgeon Russell Strong decades after he pioneered a first-of-its-kind transplant technique that saved their lives.Â

title.children: Former patient travels from Japan to honour pioneering transplant surgeon

image.altText: People sitting on lounge chairs under umbrellas at a beach bar.

props.synopsis: Beach bars are set to become permanent at Broadbeach in 2026 but recovery efforts to fix the city's eroded beaches are expected to take years.

title.children: Gold Coast beach bar plan met with warning about further erosion

image.altText: A large yellow vehicle, with an oversized tray on its back, travelling on dirt with a steep manmade hill in the background

props.synopsis: Bowen Coking Coal has appointed administrators after failing to negotiate deferment on its coal royalties to the Queensland government.Â

title.children: About 500 jobs in doubt as coal mine owner enters administration

image.altText: Aerial view of Mount Isa mine site.

props.synopsis: The ground in Mount Isa usually shakes twice a day with mine blasts, but today silence signals the end of era.

title.children: One of Australia's largest copper mines closes after 70 years

image.altText: Man sits at cafe with coffee, smiling for photo.

props.synopsis: Giving his first speech in the Senate, Tasmanian Labor's Josh Dolega tells young queer people: "I hope you know that you're seen, that you're understood and you are represented."

title.children: Tasmanian senator addresses queer youth in maiden speech

image.altText: A woman in a long maroon jacket whizzing by on a path on the river. Brisbane skyline behind.

props.synopsis: New figures from Queensland's workers' insurance agency reveal the majority of those relate to people riding an e-scooter on their way to-and-from work.

title.children: E-bikes and e-scooters responsible for $25m in workers' insurance claims

image.altText: A man carrying a rifle hanging from one hand walks across concrete, with a yellow square added around him.

props.synopsis: Shane Tamura, the gunman who killed four people inside a New York office this week before turning the gun on himself, was carrying a handwritten note in his wallet claiming he had CTE. What does that mean?Â

title.children: The NYC gunman left a note to 'study my brain' for CTE. What does it mean?

image.altText: A graphic showing a hand holding a phone. It is superimposed on a drawing of Australia and surrounded by social media apps

props.synopsis: Australia is months away from implementing its world-first social media ban for teens. But questions still remain around how the restrictions will work.Â

title.children: How will the teen social media ban work? Here's what we know

image.altText: Man in suit holding an umbrella with journalists beside him.

props.synopsis: NSW MP Gareth Ward has been taken into custody following his conviction for sexually abusing two young men. A judge has revoked his bail ahead of sentencing.Â

title.children: MP Gareth Ward jailed ahead of sex crime sentence
